title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance is set to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS may integrate sports broadcasting, potentially impacting MLB, NHL, and college football coverage.
Netflix may negotiate for CBS's NFL game rights in future broadcast deals, aiming to expand its sports offerings.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots express interest in A.J. Brown, but find the Eagles' current trade asking price too high.
Trading Brown before June 1 would cost the Eagles $44M in dead money but offer cap relief after this date.
A.J. Brown carries a $7.04M cap hit for 2026; Patriots may restructure Stefon Diggs's contract to fit their roster.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts transitions from E-ZPass transponders to RFID sticker tags, starting Sunday for highway toll collection.
New E-ZPass sticker tags will save Massachusetts approximately $7.4 million annually in production costs.
The sticker tags, issued for free, replace $6.70 transponders, previously requiring a $20 replacement fee.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito, 47, from Woburn, charged with tax evasion and filing false returns, pleaded not guilty in Middlesex Superior Court.
Prosecutors claim Brito's company underreported over $20 million in income, evading more than $1.2 million in personal taxes.
Authorities found $35,000 cash and documents in searches of Brito's home and Medford business, Boston Quality Cleaning Services.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Avian influenza confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system; public health advisory issued by officials.
Boston Public Health Commission advises avoiding contact with wildlife; risk to general public remains low.
CDC reports 71 human cases of bird flu since 2024; symptoms similar to seasonal flu, potential for serious outcomes.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Top draft prospect Fernando Mendoza hopes for mentorship from Tom Brady with the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, 22, is the 2026 Heisman Trophy winner, leading Indiana Hoosiers to a National Championship.
Despite being a likely first draft pick, Mendoza remains open to any team selection in the NFL Draft.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' (2025) featuring Jennifer Lopez is now streaming on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' (2026) documentary is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 Part 2 is streaming on Netflix, focusing on Benedict Bridgerton's storyline.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox's Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided in the outfield during a spring training game against the Braves.
Despite the collision, both players stayed in the game and successfully recorded hits against former teammate Chris Sale.
Post-game, Anthony and Rafaela attributed the collision to a communication error and reported only minor injuries.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund when a player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation would be his largest public contribution to the Jimmy Fund, supporting Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
In 2021, Cora donated based on Red Sox wins and runs, showcasing his ongoing support for the Jimmy Fund.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, targeting instruction on critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues in schools.
The bill prohibits lessons that promote division or question the legitimacy of U.S. institutions, advocating a neutral educational stance.
Teachers violating the act could face disciplinary action, and individuals may sue schools for up to $10,000 per violation.
